Name: The Irish Heather
Notes: Niall S. Works as door man here, bf of Heeya
Written email / cover letter: Hi Sean,My name is Alex and I am emailing to inquire about any employment opportunities you may have as a bartender or barback. I've got more than 2 full years of part time experience, fully licenced, and ready to provide references - BUT, I'm sure you hear that everyday.What sets me apart is what I can do outside of bartending: - I planned, set-up, marketed, and host a weekly karaoke event at the bar I currently tend at. This event brings in ~$1k - 1.5K extra on the nights that it's hosted. - I have lots of experience setting up sound systems (DJs or live bands) - I run the finances and organizational structure of an independent artist collective called funhouse. Events I run with this group net $700 - $1200, allowing the artists to pursue their art.My full resume is attached, and I am ready to send over references if needed.Best, Alex Griniusp.s. Not sure how to fit this into the email, but I have lived with irish people before, enjoy the craic and whiskey.

Name: Tap & Barrel - Convention Centre
Notes: I think Owain’s family is involved somehow here
Written email / cover letter:
One of the first times I was entrusted to solo close the college bar, I had everything done and cleared away within 30 mins of closing, and the only thing left to do was take out the trash. While taking it out, the door stop slipped and I was locked out. No sweat, the building operations manager is scheduled to still be around for another 30 minutes. He left early that night. Campus security was my next best bet. They didn't think 'I left the lights on' constituted an emergency, so there was nothing they could do. I was now in territory uncharted by the SOP manual. I took a guess that one of the overnight cleaners (responsible for the whole student building, not the bar, we had our own cleaning staff), might have access. I quickly found a janitor that I had shared cookies with after a shift a month or so before this, and explained my situation. He said he didn't have an official key to the place, but her could try. The UBC student building uses many of the same locks; I was in, closed the lights, and went home.

I had been keeping my manager updated on the situation in real time, although he was asleep at the time.
